envPropDefs.name: was.user
envPropDefs.label: was.user
envPropDefs.description: WCBD WAS User for login to WAS Admin console

envPropDefs.name: was.password
envPropDefs.label: was.password
envPropDefs.description: WCBD WAS USER password for login to was admin console

envPropDefs.name: db.user.name
envPropDefs.label: db.user.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Database user

envPropDefs.name: db.user.password
envPropDefs.label: db.user.password
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Database user password

envPropDefs.name: was.profile.name
envPropDefs.label: was.profile.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD The name of the WebSphere Application Server profile, on the system where the deployment process is run, that will be used as the administative client to invoke the wsadmin utility to update the deployed WebSphere Commerce application. This profile does not need to be the profile in which the WebSphere Commerce application is deployed; It is only used to facilitate wsadmin connection to the WebSphere Application Server, remote or otherwise. You must create a new Application Server profile using the Profile Management Tool or the manageprofiles utility if you do not have an existing one which the deployment process can use.

envPropDefs.name: was.use.dmgr
envPropDefs.label: was.use.dmgr
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Whether the target environment uses a Network Deployment Manager to manage the deployed WebSphere Commerce application in a federated or clustered configuration.

envPropDefs.name: was.host.list
envPropDefs.label: was.host.list
envPropDefs.description: WCBD The comma-separated list of host names with a running application server or DMGR instance to deploy to. It should be set as follows:

envPropDefs.name: was.port
envPropDefs.label: was.port
envPropDefs.description: WCBD The port corresponding to ${was.conntype} that the wsadmin utility will use to connect to the server. 10003 for dev, 12003 for QA, 14003 for pre-prod, 16003 for prod

envPropDefs.name: db.name
envPropDefs.label: db.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Databse name

envPropDefs.name: db.schema.name
envPropDefs.label: db.schema.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Database schema name

envPropDefs.name: jdbc.url
envPropDefs.label: jdbc.url
envPropDefs.description: WCBD The JDBC URL. Use the value corresponding to the database vendor listed below unless you have special requirements to use other JDBC drivers which requires a different URL, or include other parameters in the URL.

envPropDefs.name: datasource.jndi.name
envPropDefs.label: datasource.jndi.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD JNDI name of the default datasource that will be mapped to entity beans

envPropDefs.name: rollout.update
envPropDefs.label: rollout.update
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Whether rollout update should be used when updating the WebSphere Commerce application. This option only works for clustered or federated environment managed by a DMGR. IF you set this to true, set STOP_START_SERVERS=false below This should only be used for production environments

envPropDefs.name: rollout.update.timeout
envPropDefs.label: rollout.update.timeout
envPropDefs.description: WCBD The timeout value for rollout update. You might need to increase this value depending on how large your customized WebSphere Commerce application is.

envPropDefs.name: partial.app.full.update
envPropDefs.label: partial.app.full.update
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Whether the partial application update should be performed as a full update, which the binaries directory is erased and the content of the updated EAR file is completely extracted. Setting this value to true may improve the deployment time if the partial application zip file contains a large number of files.

envPropDefs.name: solr.node.list
envPropDefs.label: solr.node.list
envPropDefs.description: WCBD list of solr servers in cluster

envPropDefs.name: wcbd.deploy.dir
envPropDefs.label: wcbd.deploy.dir
envPropDefs.description: The custom deploy directory where deploy zips will be placed

envPropDefs.name: wcbd.auth.instance.name
envPropDefs.label: wcbd.auth.instance.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Authoring Instance Name

envPropDefs.name: wcbd.live.instance.name
envPropDefs.label: wcbd.live.instance.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Runtime Instance Name

envPropDefs.name: wcbd.auth.db.host.name
envPropDefs.label: wcbd.auth.db.host.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Authoring DB HostName

envPropDefs.name: wcbd.live.db.host.name
envPropDefs.label: wcbd.live.db.host.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD Runtime DB HostName

envPropDefs.name: wcbd.target.name
envPropDefs.label: wcbd.target.name
envPropDefs.description: WCBD name of Target Environment

envPropDefs.name: webserver.node.list
envPropDefs.label: webserver.node.list
envPropDefs.description: List of webservers to deploy static content to seoerated by commas

envPropDefs.name: static.wars
envPropDefs.label: static.wars
envPropDefs.description: List of wars you are deploying static content from (i.e. Stores, LOBTools, CommerceAcclerator, etc...

envPropDefs.name: webserver.username
envPropDefs.label: webserver.username
envPropDefs.description: User name to copy static content to webserver

envPropDefs.name: ssh.keyfile
envPropDefs.label: ssh.keyfile
envPropDefs.description: ssh keyfile to use to copy static content

envPropDefs.name: webserver.documentroot
envPropDefs.label: webserver.documentroot
envPropDefs.description: DocumentRoot on the webserver

properties.name: jdbc.driver
properties.description: WCBD JDBC driver class name, should correspond to dtatabase vendor.

properties.name: jdbc.driver.path
properties.description: WCBD The classpath that contains the JDBC driver and other libraries it depends on, like license jar.

properties.name: mail.mailhost
properties.description: WCBD The host name of the SMTP server.

properties.name: mail.mailport
properties.description: WCBD The TCP port of the SMTP server.

properties.name: mail.ssl
properties.description: WCBD Whether the SMTP server uses TLS/SSL for encryption.

properties.name: partial.app.zip.excludes
properties.description: WCBD The comma-separated list of files in ${working.dir}/partialapp to be excluded in the partial application zip file. Leave the value of this property empty to not exclude any file.

properties.name: run.mail.failure
properties.description: WCBD Whether deployment failure notifications should be sent.

properties.name: run.mail.success
properties.description: WCBD Whether deployment success notifications should be sent.

properties.name: run.static.web.deploy
properties.description: WCBD whether static Web server assets should be deployed.

properties.name: static.web.dir.includes
properties.description: WCBD The comma-separated list of files in ${static.web.dir} to be included fromdeployment. Leave the value of this property empty to include all files.

properties.name: was.conntype
properties.description: WCBD The type of connection that the wsadmin utility will use to connect to the server on which the WebSphere Commerce application is deployed. Use the default SOAP connection type unless you have special requirements to use other connection types.

properties.name: was.home
properties.description: WCBD The WebSphere Application Server installation directory

properties.name: was.jvm.max.memory
properties.description: WCBD The maximum size of the memory for the JVM in which the wsadmin utility is run.

properties.name: wc.home
properties.description: WCBD The WebSphere Commerce installation directory.

processes.name: Deploy Custom WC App using WCBD
processes.description: Deploy Custom WC App using WCBD

propDefs.name: wcbd.deploy.isstopstartservers
propDefs.label: Is Stop/Start Application
propDefs.description: Should we stop  the application while we do the deploy.

propDefs.name: wcbd.deploy.isdeployauth
propDefs.label: Do Deploy to Authoring
propDefs.description: If true, we will deploy application to Authoring

propDefs.name: wcbd.deploy.isdeploylive
propDefs.label: Do Deploy to Live
propDefs.description: If true, we will deploy application to Live

propDefs.name: wcbd.deploy.isstaticonly
propDefs.label: Run Static Html Only
propDefs.description: If true, do not deploy code or database,  only copy static files to webserver

propDefs.name: wcbd.deploy.isrunoncesql
propDefs.label: Do Runonce SQLs
propDefs.description: Note: SHOULD BE TRUE TO RUN RUNONCE, then turrned off.  Whether common SQL data files are to be loaded in order as specified in property.

children.pluginName: IBM UrbanCode Deploy Versioned File Storage
children.name: Download Artifacts

children.componentProcessName: Sub Process Create WCBD Deploy Dir
children.name: Create WCBD Deploy Dir

was.user
was.password
db.user.name
db.user.password
mail.user
mail.password

was.user
was.password

db.user.password
mail.user

processes.name: Sub Process Create WCBD Deploy Dir
processes.description: A sub process that will create the deploy directory

edges.to: Allow other User to read directory

edges.from: Allow other User to read directory

offsets.name: Allow other User to read directory

children.name: Allow other User to read directory

processes.name: Sub Process Run WCBD
processes.description: A sub process that will Run WCBD

propDefs.name: restart_app
propDefs.label: restart_app
propDefs.description: Checkbox to tell process to restart Application

propDefs.name: static_only
propDefs.label: static_only
propDefs.description: Copy over Static Html to WebServer only

processes.name: Sub Process Static HTML Deploy
processes.description: A sub process that will copy static HTML files to Web Servers

properties.contents:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<!--
 ===============================================================================
 Wc static content deploy. Overrides any static deploy being done by client's WCBD.
 ===============================================================================
-->
<project name="wc-static-web-deploy" default="deployweb">

   <target name="deployweb" description="copy static content to the web servers">
      <if>
          <istrue value="${run.static.web.deploy}" />
      <then>
         <delete dir="${working.dir}" quiet="true" /> 
         <mkdir dir="${working.dir}/web" />                   
         <foreach list="${static.wars}" param="war" target="staticwars" parallel="false" inheritall="true"/>         
      </then>
         <else>
            <echo message="SKIPPING updating web server. run.static.web.deploy is false."/>
          </else>
      </if>
   </target>
   
   <target name="dodeployweb" description="copy static content to the web servers">
      <if>
         <available file="${working.dir}/web/static.zip" type="file"/>
      <then>       
            <echo message="Copying static content to ${webserver} directory: ${webserver.documentroot}"/>
            <if>
               <equals arg1="${webserver}" arg2="localhost"/>
            <then>
               <copy file="${working.dir}/web/static.zip"
                           tofile="${webserver.documentroot}/static.zip"
                           overwrite="true"/>            
  
               <unzip dest="${webserver.documentroot}/${war}.war" src="${webserver.documentroot}/static.zip"/>                    
            </then>
            <else>
               <try>
               <scp todir="${webserver.username}@${webserver}:${webserver.documentroot}"
                         keyfile="${ssh.keyfile}" trust="true">
                        <fileset dir="${working.dir}/web" includes="static.zip"/>
               </scp>
               <catch>
                  <fail message="SCP of static.zip failed"/>
               </catch>
               </try>                               
               <sshexec host="${webserver}"
                                 username="${webserver.username}"
                                 keyfile="${ssh.keyfile}" 
                                 trust="true"                                                                                 
                                 command="umask 002; unzip -q -o ${webserver.documentroot}/static.zip -d ${webserver.documentroot}/${war}.war;ffind ${webserver.documentroot} -type d \( \! -perm 755 \) -exec chmod 755 {} \; ; find ${webserver.documentroot} -type f \( \! -perm 644 \) -exec chmod 644 {} \;"/>             
            </else>         
            </if>          
      </then>
      </if>
   </target>   

   <target name="staticwars">
         <if>
            <length string="${static.web.dir}" length="0" when="gt" trim="true" />
         <then>
            <if>
               <available file="${static.web.dir}" type="dir"/>
               <then>
                  <echo message="Creating zip file with webserver assets from ${static.web.dir}."/>                  
                  <zip destfile="${working.dir}/web/static.zip">
                     <zipfileset dir="${static.web.dir}" includes="${static.web.dir.includes}"/>
                  </zip>               
               </then>
               <else>
                  <echo message="${static.web.dir} does not exist."/>                  
               </else>
            </if>
         </then>
         <else>
            <if>
               <available file="${source.dir}/wc.ear.ext/${war}.war" type="dir"/>
            <then>            
               <echo message="Creating zip file with webserver assets from ${source.dir}/wc.ear.ext/${war}.war."/>
               <zip destfile="${working.dir}/web/static.zip">
                  <zipfileset dir="${source.dir}/wc.ear.ext/${war}.war" includes="${static.web.dir.includes}"/>
               </zip> 
            </then>
            </if>
         </else>   
         </if>
         <foreach list="${webserver.node.list}" param="webserver" target="dodeployweb" parallel="false" inheritall="true"/>          
    </target>
</project>
